tnote.storage

Class DirectoryHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tnote.storage.DirectoryHandler

  • public class DirectoryHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the directory paths and files in the system. Directories and files can be created or deleted. The files in one directory can be copied to another directory as well.
    Author:
    A0124131B

        protected boolean createDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        Method which creates a specified directory in the system
        Parameters:
        directory - File object containing the path to the directory to be created
        Returns:
        true if the directory is successfully created or if the directory already exists

                      throws java.io.IOException
        Method which creates a specified file in the system
        Parameters:
        fileToCreate - File object containing the path to the file to be created
        Returns:
        true if the file is successfully created, or if the file already exists
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error when creating the file

                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Method to delete the parent directory and all files within it
        Returns:
        true if parent directory is deleted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error deleting parent directory

      • deleteChildDirectory

        protected boolean deleteChildDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Method to delete a child directory along with all files within it
        Parameters:
        directory - String of the child directory to delete
        Returns:
        true if the directory and all its files have been deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error deleting the directory or any files within it

      • clearChildDirectory

        protected boolean clearChildDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Method to delete all files within a specified child directory
        Parameters:
        directory - String of the child directory to clear
        Returns:
        true if all files within the directory has been deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error deleting any files within the directory

      • deleteFile

        protected boolean deleteFile(java.io.File fileToDelete)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Method to delete a specified file from the system
        Parameters:
        fileToDelete - File object containing the path to the file to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if the file is successfully deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error when deleting the file

      • setNewDirectory

        protected boolean setNewDirectory(java.lang.String newDirectoryString)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Method which sets a new parent directory, copying all files over to the new directory
        Parameters:
        newDirectoryString - String of the new directory
        Returns:
        true if the directory has been successfully changed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error creating the directory, or error copying the files over to the new directory

      • appendParentDirectory

        protected java.io.File appendParentDirectory(java.lang.String fileName)
        Method which add the parent directory as a root directory of the specified file name
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to exist inside the parent directory
        Returns:
        File the object which contains the full directory path to the specified file name

        Method which adds a specified folder File as a root directory of the specified file name
        Parameters:
        folder - File object used as the root directory
        fileName - Name of the file to exist inside the specified folder
        Returns:
        File the object which contains the full directory path to the specified file name
